 who has won the most games in world cup 2018? 

 The 2018 FIFA World Cup was the 21st FIFA World Cup, an international football tournament contested by the men's national teams of the member associations of FIFA once every four years. It took place in Russia from 14 June to 15 July 2018. This was the first World Cup held in Eastern Europe, and the 11th time that it had been held in Europe. At an estimated cost of over $14.2 billion, it was the most expensive World Cup. It was also the first World Cup to use the video assistant referee (VAR) system. The final tournament involved 32 national teams, of which 31 came through qualifying competitions, while the host nation qualified automatically. Of the 32 teams, 20 had also appeared in the previous tournament in 2014, while both Iceland and Panama made their first appearances at a FIFA World Cup. A total of 64 matches were played in 12 venues across 11 cities. The 2018 World Cup was won by France, who beat Croatia 4–2 in the final. France became the seventh team to win the World Cup, and the sixth (after Uruguay, Argentina, Italy, England and West Germany) to win the tournament on home soil.

Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. The team's home ground is the M. A. Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai and their captain is Mahendra Singh Dhoni. The Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) is a franchise cricket team based in Hyderabad, Telangana, that plays in the Indian Premier League (IPL). The team is owned by Kalanithi Maran of the Sun TV Network and was founded in 2012 after the Hyderabad-based Deccan Chargers were terminated by the IPL. The team's captain is David Warner and their home ground is the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium. In the 2018 season, the CSK won the match between the two teams by 8 wickets.

 The Dark Knight Rises is a 2012 superhero film directed by Christopher Nolan, who co-wrote the screenplay with his brother Jonathan Nolan, and the story with David S. Goyer. Based on the DC Comics character Batman, it is the final installment in Nolan's The Dark Knight Trilogy, and the sequel to The Dark Knight (2008). Nolan drew inspiration from Bane's comic book debut in the 1993 "Knightfall" storyline, the 1986 series The Dark Knight Returns, and the 1999 storyline "No Man's Land".

The film was released in the United States on July 8, 2016, and grossed $875 million worldwide.

 Three Dog Night is an American rock band from Los Angeles, California, best known for their music from 1968 to 1975, during which time they achieved twenty-one consecutive Billboard Top 40 Hits and twelve gold albums. The band was formed in 1967 with core members Cory Wells (vocals), Danny Hutton (vocals, guitar), and Chuck Negron (vocals). Provide a background document from Wikipedia to answer the given question. 

 who won the second battle of el alamein? 

 The Second Battle of El Alamein (23 October – 11 November 1942) was a battle of the Second World War that took place near the Egyptian railway halt of El Alamein. With the Allies victorious, it marked the watershed of the Western Desert Campaign. The First Battle of El Alamein and the Battle of Alam el Halfa had prevented the Axis from advancing further into Egypt. The Second Battle of El Alamein revived the morale of the Allies, being the first big success against the Axis since Operation Crusader in late 1941. The battle coincided with the Allied invasion of French North Africa in Operation Torch, which started on 8 November, the Battle of Stalingrad and the Guadalcanal Campaign. The battle started on 23 October with an Allied bombardment and ended on 11 November with the surrender of the Axis forces. More than 80,000 prisoners were taken, along with hundreds of tanks and over 1,000 guns. British losses amounted to around 13,500 killed and wounded, while the Axis losses were far heavier, with over 25,000 killed and wounded and nearly 140,000 captured. 



 Provide a background document from Wikipedia to answer the given question. 

 seven wonders of the world as of january 2018? 

 The Seven Wonders of the World (from left to right, top to bottom): Great Pyramid of Giza, Hanging Gardens of Babylon, Temple of Artemis, Statue of Zeus at Olympia, Mausoleum at Halicarnassus, Colossus of Rhodes, and Lighthouse of Alexandria. The Seven Wonders of the World were a collection of remarkable constructions listed by various Greek and Roman authors. The most notable of these lists was compiled by Antipater of Sidon and published during the 2nd century BC. The original list of the Seven Wonders of the World included: the Great Pyramid of Giza, the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, the Temple of Artemis, the Statue of Zeus at Olympia, the Mausoleum at Halicarnassus, the Colossus of Rhodes, and the Lighthouse of Alexandria. The Seven Wonders of the World have been celebrated by many different cultures for centuries. In recent years, there has been a movement to create a new, modern list of the Seven Wonders of the World. This new list includes: the Great Wall of China, the Petra in Jordan, the Christ the Redeemer statue in Brazil, Machu Picchu in Peru, Chichen Itza in Mexico, the Colosseum in Italy, and the Taj Mahal in India.

 what military hero from the mexican war became potus? 

 Zachary Taylor (November 24, 1784 – July 9, 1850) was the 12th president of the United States, serving from March 1849 until his death in July 1850. Before his presidency, Taylor was a career officer in the United States Army, rising to the rank of major general. He was a planter in Kentucky and owned slaves. Taylor's status as a national hero as a result of his victories in the Mexican–American War won him election to the White House despite his vague political beliefs. His top priority as president was preserving the Union, but he died sixteen months into his term, before making any progress on the status of slavery, which had led to conflict in the 1850s. 



 Provide a background document from Wikipedia to answer the given question. 

 when is a census of the population to be taken? 

 A census is an official count of the number of people in a region. The term is used mostly in connection with national population and housing censuses; other common censuses include agriculture, business, and traffic censuses. The United Nations defines the essential features of population and housing censuses as "individual enumeration, universality within a defined territory, simultaneity and defined periodicity", and recommends that population censuses be taken at least every 10 years. United Nations recommendations also cover census topics to be collected, official definitions, classifications and other useful information to co-ordinate international practice. Census counts are necessary to adjust samples to be representative of a population by weighting them as is common in opinion polling. Similarly, stratification requires knowledge of the relative sizes of different population strata which can be derived from census enumerations. In some countries, the census provides the official counts used to apportion the number of elected representatives to regions. In many cases, a carefully chosen random sample can provide more accurate information than attempts to get a population census. A census is often construed as the opposite of a sample as its intent is to count everyone in a population rather than a fraction. As a result of the dangers of a population census, some countries have moved to more expensive and more accurate alternatives, such as the sampling techniques used by the market research industry.

 The Restored Church of God (RCG) is a breakaway group from the Worldwide Church of God (WCG), founded in 1998 by David C. Pack. It is headquartered in Wadsworth, Ohio, United States. The church teaches a form of British Israelism, and claims to be the only true church. It also teaches that the world is currently in a "Great Tribulation" which will culminate in the "Battle of Armageddon", after which Jesus Christ will return to earth and establish his millennial kingdom.

 total number of seats in senate of pakistan? 

 The Senate of Pakistan (Urdu: سنتِ پاکستان‎ — Sénat-e Pākistān) is the upper legislative chamber of the bicameral legislature of Pakistan, and together with the National Assembly makes up the Parliament of Pakistan. First convened in 1973, the Senate's composition and powers are established by the Article 59 of the Constitution of Pakistan. It consists of 104 senators, elected for six-year terms by the members of the Provincial Assemblies of Pakistan, with equal representation for each province. There are two exceptions to this: the Senate of Pakistan has four seats reserved for women and 17 seats reserved for technocrats and professionals. The Chairman of the Senate, under the constitution, is the President of Pakistan, and the Vice Chairman is the Chairman of the Senate. The current Chairman of the Senate is Sadiq Sanjrani and the current Vice Chairman is Saleem Mandviwalla. 



 Provide a background document from Wikipedia to answer the given question. 

 total national assembly seats in pakistan in election 2018? 

 The National Assembly of Pakistan is the lower house of the bicameral legislature of Pakistan, and along with the Senate makes up the Parliament of Pakistan. The National Assembly is a democratically elected body consisting of a total of 342 members, of which 272 are directly elected constituents and 70 reserved seats for women and religious minorities. Members of the National Assembly are elected by the people through the first-past-the-post system under universal adult suffrage, representing electoral districts known as National Assembly constituencies. According to the constitution, the National Assembly of Pakistan has the power to legislate except on matters included in the concurrent list. Both the Senate and the National Assembly can initiate and pass legislation except for financial bills, which can only be introduced in the National Assembly by the government.

 where is the country of holy see located? 

 The Holy See (Latin: Sancta Sedes, Ecclesiastical Latin: [ˈsaŋkta ˈsedes]; Italian: Santa Sede) is the apostolic episcopal see of the bishop of Rome, known as the Pope, ex cathedra (from Latin: "from the chair (of Saint Peter)") and the head of the Catholic Church. The primacy of the Roman bishop is largely derived from his role as the traditional successor to Saint Peter, to whom primacy was conferred by Jesus, giving him the Keys of Heaven and the powers of "binding and loosing", naming him as the "rock" upon which the church would be built.

 where does the olive ridley sea turtle live? 

 The olive ridley sea turtle (Lepidochelys olivacea), also known as the Pacific ridley sea turtle, is a species of sea turtle found in warm and tropical waters, primarily in the Pacific and Indian Oceans. They can be found in coastal regions from North America to South America, and are particularly abundant off the coast of Mexico. Olive ridley turtles are omnivorous, and their diet consists of crabs, shrimp, mollusks, and fish. The olive ridley turtle is the smallest and most abundant of all sea turtles. It is named for its olive-colored carapace, and is closely related to the Kemp's ridley turtle. 



 Provide a background document from Wikipedia to answer the given question. 

 where does the day of the dead originate? 

 The Day of the Dead is a Mexican holiday celebrated throughout Mexico, in particular the Central and South regions, and by people of Mexican ancestry living in other places, especially the United States. It is acknowledged internationally in many other cultures. The multi-day holiday involves family and friends gathering to pray for and remember friends and family members who have died, and help support their spiritual journey. In Mexican culture, death is viewed as a natural part of the human cycle. Mexicans view it as a moment to celebrate life and to remember loved ones who have died. The holiday is sometimes called Día de los Muertos in Anglophone countries, a back-translation of its original name, Día de Muertos. It is particularly celebrated in Mexico where the day is a public holiday. Prior to Spanish colonization in the 16th century, the celebration took place at the beginning of summer. Gradually, it was associated with October 31, November 1, and November 2 to coincide with the Western Christian triduum of Allhallowtide: All Hallows' Eve, Hallowmas, and All Souls' Day. Traditions connected with the holiday include building private altars called ofrendas, honoring the deceased using calaveras, aztec marigolds, and the favorite foods and beverages of the departed, and visiting graves with these as gifts. Visitors also leave possessions of the deceased at the graves.
